com.swopteam07.tablr.CanvasWindow

Class CanvasWindow

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.swopteam07.tablr.CanvasWindow.CanvasWindow
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Controller

    public class CanvasWindow
extends java.lang.Object
    A window for custom drawing. To use this class, create a subclass, say MyCanvasWindow, that overrides methods paint(Graphics), handleMouseEvent(int,int,int,int), and handleKeyEvent(int,int,char), and then launch it from your main method as follows: 
     public static void main(String[] args) {
     java.awt.EventQueue.invokeLater(() -> {
         new MyCanvasWindow("My Canvas Window").show();
     });
 }

    • Method Detail

      • setTitle

        public void setTitle(java.lang.String title)

      • recordSession

        public final void recordSession(java.lang.String path)

      • repaint

        protected final void repaint()
        Call this method if the canvas is out of date and needs to be repainted. This will cause method paint(Graphics) to be called after the current call of method handleMouseEvent or handleKeyEvent finishes.

      • paint

        protected void paint(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Called to allow you to paint on the canvas.

        You should not use the Graphics object after you return from this method.

        Parameters:
        g - This object offers the methods that allow you to paint on the canvas.

      • handleMouseEvent

        protected void handleMouseEvent(int id,
                                int x,
                                int y,
                                int clickCount)
        Called when the user presses (id == MouseEvent.MOUSE_PRESSED), releases (id == MouseEvent.MOUSE_RELEASED), or drags (id == MouseEvent.MOUSE_DRAGGED) the mouse.
        Parameters:
        e - Details about the event
